With a talented cast including Steve Buscemi and Debi Mazar, it's a must-see for anyone looking for a nuanced and relatable tragicomedy.

Based on your interest in a war-themed movie, I think you might really enjoy "Patton" (1970). This film tells the story of the World War II career of George S. Patton, one of the most iconic and complex military leaders in history. With an all-star cast, including George C. Scott and Karl Malden, this biographical war drama is sure to provide a thrilling and thought-provoking experience.

Alternatively, if you're open to a more contemporary take on the war genre, "Three Kings" (1999) could be a great fit. This critically acclaimed film follows three American soldiers who stumble upon a cache of gold in Iraq after the Gulf War and find themselves caught up in a complex moral dilemma. With a talented ensemble cast that includes George Clooney and Mark Wahlberg, this movie is both action-packed and thought-provoking.

If you're looking for something more intense and action-packed, "Oldboy" (2003) might be up your alley. It's a gripping revenge thriller about a man who seeks justice after being held captive for 15 years. The film's unique storyline and memorable performances make it a standout in the war genre.
